Thanks alot Alan for that information, i tried to translate it my self from=
 internet sources, but i did not mannage to do that, (im just an amature).
=
I have an question about the Mei=B4s, the picture called "side1", is that w=
here the Smiths name is??, and on the other side is that where the year and=
 location of the smith is?
is it a smith that anyone has heard of before?

=
Best Regards

Patrik


It is signed Shinto Minamoto Yoshikuni and dated Kan=
sei 7 (1795), probably
the 3rd-4th generation, lived at Morioka in Mutsu.
A=
lan

lo to you alla again.

The sword has arrived, it was much better that i tho=
ught it would be, the
blade has a lot of dried oil on it , need to get this=
 off in a nice and
smoth way, and i FINALY get the Tsuka off it, i understa=
nd why the former
owner didnt want to take it off, the mekugi has been ther=
e for a long time.
But anyway i did found Mei on both sides of the Nakago, =
i have taken 2
pictures of it , more comming on the blade, mountings,and sa=
ya, when my
camera are ready again.
Can anyone translate the mei=B4s on it?=
??
